column3:
Qhoterl Pasol wants to give the Stopple a touch of home.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Deliver the requested items to Qhoterl Pasol.

<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),16))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Mine splendid slate in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta<Else/>Deliver the splendid slate to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),17))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Gather splendid water ivy in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta<Else/>Deliver the splendid water ivy to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),18))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Catch a splendid eryops at Lake Tusi Mek'ta<Else/>Deliver the splendid eryops to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/></If></If></If>.
Ours is a large undertaking, and we expect to be hunkered down here for a good long while. That being the case, I've a mind to add some creature comforts to the Stopple.

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I'd be in your debt if you could procure a few things to help me make this place a home away from home.
Specifically, I require three slabs of slate. These can be had in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta. Many thanks, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, and happy digging!
Specifically, I require three lengths of water ivy. These can be had in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta. Many thanks, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, and happy gathering!
Specifically, I require an eryops. They dwell in the waters of Lake Tusi Mek'ta, and are passing fond of fruit worms. Many thanks, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, and happy fishing!
While there's no avoiding getting a little wet, the slate ought not pose you too much trouble. I await your return with bated breath!
While there's no avoiding getting a little wet, the water ivy ought not pose you too much trouble. I await your return with bated breath!
So long as you use fruit worms as bait, the eryops ought not pose you too much trouble. I await your return with bated breath!
Ah, there you are, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>. May I ask if you have that which I requested?
Yes, this is absolutely splendid! My gratitude!

By making the Stopple more comfortable, our workers will be better rested. And a rested worker is a <Emphasis>productive</Emphasis> worker! Oh yes, perhaps we can look into extending the length of shifts...
